meanings.definition: The branch of philosophy dealing with beauty and taste.
meanings.sent1: Studying esthetics helps us understand what is considered beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator carefully considered the esthetics of each painting before arranging the exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his sense of esthetics was so bad, he once wore mismatched socks to a fancy event.
meanings.sent4: The esthetics of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The esthetics of the garden were so breathtaking that visitors often stopped to admire the flowers.

meanings.definition: The set of principles underlying and guiding the work of a particular artist or artistic movement.
meanings.sent1: The esthetics of the Renaissance focused on symmetry and proportion.
meanings.sent2: The esthetics of the Art Deco movement influenced architecture and design in the 1920s.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer's unique esthetics led to a collection that combined vintage and modern styles.
meanings.sent4: The esthetics of the ballet performance transported the audience to a magical world.
meanings.sent5: The esthetics of the film were so captivating that it won multiple awards for its visual appeal.
